VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
Maltreatment in Care
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has submitted 2 acceptable corrective action plans (CAP) during this
licensing period, and compliance with each individual CAP is as follows:
The facility had two special investigation during this period under reviewed with two
resulting in corrective actions. The non-compliance noted within both investigations
were staff not following the proper restraint model the facility trains on during a
restraint with a youth. The facility's corrective action plan compliance is monitored
quarterly. They facility has been in compliance with meeting the expectations of the
set deadlines of tasks within their corrective action plans.
Financial Overview
There are no financial concerns identified based on the review of the facility’s
budget and the agency’s financial audit.
PREA compliance (if applicable)
Not Applicable
Chief Administrator Assessment
Not Applicable
Staff and Youth Interviews
Staff interviews were conducted during the inspection and no issues or concerns
were raised. The staff reported feeling supported by direct supervisors as well as
administration. They reported feeling an adequate amount of training and well
versed in the restraint model training. The staff indicated no concerns with
restraints they observed or participated in.
Three youth were interviewed during the inspection and reported feeling safe at the
facility. They reported they feel supportive by staff to make progress in their goals
and behaviors. The youth indicated no concerns with restraints they have observed
or been in with staff and noted staff use verbal de-escalation prior and only go
hands on when the situation is not safe. Two of the youth noted they wanted
increased portion size of food due to be bigger males. They both indicated they get
a proper amount of food but would like to eat more frequently than the three
3

scheduled mealtimes and snack time. The youth both reported they have been able
to follow up with staff and administration on this and it has been addressed.
Description of Agency Walk Through
An on-site inspection and walkthrough of the facility occurred on May 18, 2023.
There were no issues or safety concerns noted.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules. It is recommended that the agency continue on their regular license.
